data.title: Roseanna by Maj Sjowall and Per Wahloo: Very Good + (1967)
data.meta_description: 1st Edition - Pantheon Books, a Division of Random House, New York - 1967 - Condition: Very Good + - Very Good + - New York: Pantheon Books, a Division of Random House, 1967. First U.S. Edition. Octavo. 212 pp. Illustrated dust jacket with "$4.50" price present. Green boards decorated in blue, yellow, and red; purple topstain. Most likely ex-library though with markings removed (more info below). Dust jacket rubbed and lightly creased along edges; no institutional markings to dust jacket. Boards show ghost of tape strips to front and rear; minor fraying to top interior edge of rear board. Binding is sound. Evidence of removal of (presumably institutional) markings to endpapers, title page, and bottom edge of text block; glue stain to rear endpapers; interior otherwise unmarked. Overall a Very Good or better copy of the first book in the Martin Beck series. - Roseanna
data.text:
About this Item

New York: Pantheon Books, a Division of Random House, 1967. First U.S. Edition. Octavo. 212 pp. Illustrated dust jacket with "$4.50" price present. Green boards decorated in blue, yellow, and red; purple topstain. Most likely ex-library though with markings removed (more info below). Dust jacket rubbed and lightly creased along edges; no institutional markings to dust jacket. Boards show ghost of tape strips to front and rear; minor fraying to top interior edge of rear board. Binding is sound. Evidence of removal of (presumably institutional) markings to endpapers, title page, and bottom edge of text block; glue stain to rear endpapers; interior otherwise unmarked. Overall a Very Good or better copy of the first book in the Martin Beck series. Seller Inventory # 27201

Contact seller

Report this item

We are a neighborhood independent bookstore in Washington, D.C.'s Capitol Hill neighborhood, across from Eastern Market.

Visit Seller's Storefront

Association Member Members of these associations are committed to maintaining the highest standards. They vouch for the authenticity of all items offered for sale. They provide expert and detailed descriptions, disclose all significant defects and/or restorations, provide clear and accurate pricing, and operate with fairness and honesty during the purchase experience.

Seller's business information

Hecatomb Holdings, LLC

657 C Street, SE, Washington, DC, 20003, U.S.A.

Terms of Sale:

We guarantee the condition of every book as it's described on the Abebooks web sites. If

you're dissatisfied with your purchase (Incorrect Book/Not as Described/Damaged) or if the

order hasn't arrived, you're eligible for a refund within 30 days of the estimated delivery

date. If you've changed your mind about a book that you've ordered, please use the Ask

bookseller a question link to contact us and we'll respond within 2 business days.

Shipping Terms:

Orders generally ship via USPS within 1-2 business days in new, sturdy boxes.

For International orders: the default average shipping weight on AbeBooks is based upon a 2.2 lb (1 kg) package, so heavier books or sets will often require extra postage. Feel free to contact us for estimates. Customs declarations will clssify the contents as Merchandise, described as "Book (used)" and valued at the book's purchase price (sans shipping).
